attributes.action: recognise that the whole of the UK is entitled to free prescriptions.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I am one of the 11% who still has to pay £7.20 per prescription.  I suffer with chronic asthma and am prescribed with at least 6/7 items of medication per month.  Because my illness is not on the list of illnesses that is recognised as being 'exempt' from prescription charges, I am still eligible to pay full prescription charges.  Can somebody please tell me how this is fair?  Surely, if we all have the same NHS Service, we should all either pay the same charges or, not pay at all!!  Come on England, catch up with the rest of the United Kingdom!!

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
